docs.lead_paragraph: Hector Saliva battled many illnesses in his life, but when his wife, Alfida Figueroa, 42, remembers him, she does not describe a sick man. ''He was a big, loud, hardheaded, Puerto Rican man,'' she said, smiling. ''Tall, very tall, also. He would laugh and fill the room with his laughter.''

headline.main: The Neediest Cases; Carrying On Traditions After the Death of a Husband

docs.abstract: Alfida Figueroa, Harlem widow raising two children alone, receives help from Children's Aid Society; photo (M)

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: NEW YORK TIMES NEEDIEST CASES FUND

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''Medicare, in a Different Tack, Moves to Link Doctors' Payments to Performance'' (news article, Dec. 12): Representative Pete Stark of California is correct when he says, ''The entire concept of pay-for-performance is offensive.'' The idea that I will work smarter for a few pennies more demeans me as a person and as a professional.
docs.abstract: Dr Paul Bloustein letter finds proposal on Medicare law to link doctors' payments to performance offensive (Dec 12 article)
